part.narration: The darkness shifts shape into a warm, colorful port town. Rushing into mind are moments, entities, time and space — a world. Sun, light, voices. People. Life? Yuki — NoLifeQueen — gazes about. Camera dolly out extremely far. Vision text appears for every object in view.She so expertly imagines the full possibilities and consequences of—
Hanging from a propellerless helicopter just above the rooftops is a man in pajamas. From the studio-quality driver of a netbook microphone, to his fellow player he communicates:
part.line: Try a ladder, Try a rooftop, Try the stairs, try something!

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen climbs up a ladder and takes too long. The helicopter shoots the ladder down.
choice.line: Climb faster!

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen enters a building and spends too much time in it. The helicopter blows up the insides, launching NoLifeQueen out of a window.
choice.line: Move faster!

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen walks up a flight of stairs like she has all the time in the world. The helicopter shoots at her.
choice.line: Run faster!

part.narration: NoLifeQueen finally gets close to the helicopter.
NoLifeQueen grabs onto the copter bottom. She and the ally hang for a time. The helicopter repeats its path. Buildigns are long afar. The pair retain their hang to chat.The music stops.
The helicopter rises. The two continue chatting. The wind a-whistles.
part.line: We've got a lot of customers still paying twice a month for this game.
We better keep it playable. That means taking out this griefer.
Do you know how to form a Clan?

choice.line: I'll figure it out myself.
Good luck, then.
choice.narration: Silence. The wind whistles. The man stares at NoLifeQueen.The Player is expected to act.

choice.line: I don't know how.
choice.narration: The man pushes her off the copter.Unavoidable.
choice.line: Time to find out!

condition.line: Take the copter down!
condition.narration: How do you take down a helicopter?Quite a few possibilities here. Player can hijack the copter and pilot it down, player can get a few bros in a Clan and weigh the copter down, player can defeat copter pilots and jump off.

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen jacks the copter.Impressment mode begins when the helicopter gets close to the ground. Impressment is inversely proportional to the speed of the helicopter landing.
NoLifeQueen drops.Impressment mode begins as NoLifeQueen falls. Impressment depends on how well she lands on her feet.The helicopter raises to the level of the buildings
choice.line: We have a flying machine to sink.

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen gets the pilot out of the cockpit and roughs him up. Both of the two fall out of the copter together.Impressment depends on smoothness of foot-landing in comparison to the pilot. If the Player gets hit by the copter, dead.

condition.narration: The team cheers. They just took down a helicopter! Good little Yuki did it in a sun-dress, no less. She cheers, holding down her hat and the enemy is afoot.
condition.line: The pilots are escaping.
condition.narration: The man motions NoLifeQueen's clan over. He laughs.
condition.line: We have cheaters to catch.
condition.narration: After the two pilots Yuki's clan marathon-sprints. They shove bystanders aside, stomp plants and kick poles.Characters are slowed down when they bump into others while running. No player pants. From realized anaerobic calm rises another chat.
condition.line: So you're from Sega?
North American branch. Real Name's Davis.
And these are my bros from San Fran.
condition.narration: They wave hello and bathe Yuki in compliments.
condition.line: Together, we form INTERPOL.
INTERPOL?
The Internet Police!
condition.narration: Davis and NoLifeQueen hear a voice in the distance. The target is on a soapbox, yelling his thoughts to malleable ears.At any point, the player can knock the guy off.
condition.line: Video games are for children!
These mass marketed murder simulators mutilate their minds!
condition.narration: Davis throws NoLifeQueen a rocket launcher.This weapon is easiest for causing a ruckus. The Player must be careful not to hit the crowd. Customer Loss Condition: a gun object is destroyed.
condition.line: Every dead policeman is another Virginia Tech.
Every slain monster is Akihabara twice!
I will delete every projectile weapon!
Such is the decree of the Fathers Against Guns.

choice.line: Argh! Violence!
The admins are hurting innocent players!
Maybe the protester is right.

condition.narration: The Target and his Clan of supporters begin to delete weapons. If a weapon exists, it is deleted. If someone is holding it, it is stolen.
condition.line: Don't let them delete weapons!
condition.narration: After a while, all the Father and his sons flee.
condition.line: They're taking the rest of the guns to a warehouse?
Only a gun controls a gun.
Let's get to the warehouse.
condition.narration: The sounds of families, matters, and better-to-do things are heard through the microphones of NoLifeQueen's Clan. They overpower the noise of the mere video game. Allies begin to log out. NoLifeQueen double, triple, and quadruple takes.
condition.line: Hey, where are you all going?
Wife and kids are home from soccer practice.
Gotta get ready for the night shift.
I'm going to water my petunias.
condition.narration: Just outside the warehouse, at the dock. Crates are scattered about. It's quiet. It's dark. It's cold. NoLifeQueen shivers. She looks around. NoLifeQueen looks at the camera and motions the player over. She whispers.
condition.line: This is strange. I actually feel cold in real life—
condition.narration: Behind the crates revealed are The Father's men! They lunge at NoLifeQueen. Davis yells.
condition.line: Stop, don't shoot!
condition.narration: Punched is Davis, in the face. There is but one projectile weapon in view.
condition.line: Yuki, get into the warehouse. We'll take care of these jokers.

choice.narration: NoLifeQueen stays and fights alongside Davis and his bros.The player now may take the earlier mentioned projectile weapon warehouse.She and davis infiltrate the warehouse, its doors closing before any other after.
The Warehouse. It's pitch black. A spotlight shines on NoLifeQueen. Someone rushes by. A voice is heard from a dark corner.
choice.line: You, too, are with the Sega Corporation, I suppose?
I'm not just with them. I am them.
Yuki Soleil-Takeshi, Vice President of Sega.
More like Vice President of Death.
Silence!
choice.narration: The Father fires the first shot. The game is afoot.The spotlight in the room swerves around. The room is littered with pistols. The spotlight shifts around the room, and The Father makes an effort to push every weapon and himself into the dark. He bursts from the darkness to occasionally melee attack.NoLifeQueen defeats The Father. The father kneels on the ground.
choice.line: Go to your bookshelf and look at this game's box.
choice.narration: For a time, The Father's avatar does not move. Away from keyboard. The player can walk around safely at this time.He comes back.
choice.line: What is the rating on that box?
M, for Mature.
Just like cigarettes, alcohol, and pornography.
While you sit and protest the inevitable,
your child could be getting plastered.
And how am I to stop the world from harming my child?
Be a better parent.
choice.narration: The father sulks. He has one hit-point left.
choice.line:
Terminate my account. Yuki doesn't know how to terminate accounts. She fiddles around with the controls.This is done peacefully. All of the buttons randomly flicker between "Terminate" and other random nonviolent actions. Yuki deletes The Father's account. His avatar explodes into a flurry of hex and caught exceptions.
NoLifeQueen ditched Davis to defeat the boss. Davis died in the heat of the battle. The Father's grunts, directionless and angry, enter the warehouse to find NoLifeQueen. Get her! The grunts defeat NoLifeQueen. Game Over.
The Father's laughs can be heard through the stream of old, corrupted data. The warehouse explodes with Davis and NoLifeQueen in it. Game Over.
